review: this game was tons of fun  its not overly hard but it absolutely does have skill expression and offers the ability to grind if you want  systems have decent depth and pretty much all of the characters are fun to play  so if you like a heartwarming story ghibli style visuals and optional depth and difficulty youll love the game  plays a little more like an action game than an rpg

review: ni no kuni ii has a weird name but its actually a very fun game the switch from 3d to 2d is unique and the story while very animeish is still relatively interesting  the combat is fun and not like every other game in this genre  also it runs buttery smooth on my system  my cons are that it simply could use a better title along with more interesting characters  and just to be clear by more interesting i dont mean a bunch of big tiddy anime girls  810
game_title: Ni no Kuni II: Revenant Kingdom

review: overall its a fantastic game i originally finished it on ps4 back in 2018 and when i spotted it on the steam store recently i decided to dive back in the game offers excellent replayability though i had forgotten just how grindy it gets after the main story i didnt learn my lesson the first time but i enjoyed the challenge enough to complete it again it was definitely worth it
